headline: Bank earnings prove there's another leg in this credit cycle
summary: S&P Global Market Intelligence director of financial institutions research Nathan Stovall elaborates on how he envisions earnings growth for the banking sector in 2026 and what President Trump's proposed 10% rate cap on credit cards could mean for these earnings forecasts. Also watch Nathan Stovall comment on why bank stocks may be slipping despite generally positive earnings results. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: Palantir stock faces a pressure-cooker moment
summary: Citigroup argues that Palantir's valuation is "no problem." The alternative view is that the whole problem lasts until Feb. 2. headline: Wells Fargo Expects 2026 NII to Reach $50B: What's Fueling Growth?
summary: WFC targets $50B in 2026 NII as asset cap removal, loan growth and rising markets revenue fuel core earnings power.

headline: NYSE Builds Tokenized Platform. It’s Another Step Toward 24/7 Trading.
summary: The exchange is seeking regulatory approval for what it calls a “tokenized securities platform.” Here’s what that means.

headline: Congresswoman Violates STOCK Act With Over 200 Late Trade Disclosures: Purchases Include Mag7, Healthcare Stocks
summary: Rep. Julia Letlow (R-La.) reportedly violated a federal transparency law by failing to disclose her personal stock trades within the required time frame. Lawmaker Missed STOCK Act Trade Filings Letlow, a third-term Louisiana congresswoman, failed to disclose 224 stock and bond trades within the 45-day reporting window required under the Stop Trading on Congressional Knowledge (STOCK) Act, reported NOTUS on Thursday. headline: Trump credit card cap would cause once in a lifetime battle from banks
summary: While major bank stocks fall after reporting their fourth quarter earnings, President Trump's suggested 10% cap on credit card fees continues to weigh on the financial sector (XLF) and credit lenders. HSBC Head of US Financials Research Saul Martinez told Yahoo Finance on Tuesday that a policy like this would make the credit card industry largely "unprofitable." Whalen Global Advisors Chairman Chris Whalen explains how bank executives would respond to this type of legislation. Also catch Chris Whalen weigh in on the performance of Big Bank stocks in comparison to smaller counterparts. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Are Megabanks Next in Trump’s Crackdown on Stock Buybacks?
